column1: Mushrooms were an edible fungus. It is said that Hobbits have a passion for mushrooms
column2: surpassing even the greediest likings of Men.

column1: Mushrooms were a particular delight of young Frodo Baggins
column2: who would often steal them from Farmer Maggots fields. Old Maggot still remembered it when Frodo came to his Bamfurlong years later
column4: Mrs. Maggot gave Frodo a basket of the prized mushrooms.

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien described himself as a Hobbit in all but size
column2: noting that he was very fond of mushrooms.J.R.R. Tolkien

column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:
:Though the scenes in Maggots house have been omitted
column2: a nod to mushrooms is given when the four Hobbits escape Farmer Maggot. Peregrin Took spots them after a comment on a "short cut"
column3: making the full phrase sound as "A short cut to... mushrooms!"
column4: the chapter title.The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):
:Mushrooms are collectible items found throughout the Shire. When ate
column2: they restore 10 points of the players health.The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)

column1: :Mushrooms serve as power-ups throughout the game. One mushroom - green and blue of colour - restores one health bubble.The Hobbit (2003 video game)
column4: clustered mushrooms serve as a full healing item.The Hobbit (2003 video game)

column1: 2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Mushrooms can be grown by players who are famers by profession. Players who are cooks can make these into mushroom pie
column2: fried mushroom and fried dace with mushrooms. These are foods for low leveled characters that can increase different traits.
